MajorClaims.Text: exams have a role to play in ensuring proper and objective assessment of achievement

Claims.Text: exams need to be carefully designed and supplemented with other forms of evaluation if they are to be a truly useful component of the education system
There are clearly advantages to exams
A number of measures should be taken to address these concerns

Premises.Text: They help to ensure fairness by imposing the same conditions on all exam candidates
They are also relatively versatile; different types of exam questions, for example, multiple-choice questions and essay tasks, can test different sorts of reasoning ability
Test-wise candidates can often perform well on exams without having good underlying knowledge or skills
some test-takers perform cannot achieve a satisfying result because of anxiety
teachers and learners focus only on theses aspects of the curriculum that are likely to be tested, thus narrowing the educational experience for all
exams should match the content and activities of the learning environment
Exam task should be varied to give fair opportunities to candidates with different types of skills
Other types of assessment should also be considered, assignment writing, for example, to assess independent learning and research skills, or group projects, to measure teamwork ability
